dinosaurs.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
funFacts: T-Rex had teeth as big as bananas ‚Äî some were 12 inches long!
It could bite with 12,800 pounds of force ‚Äî that's like having three cars stacked on top of you!
T-Rex couldn't stick out its tongue like you can ‚Äî it was attached to the bottom of its mouth!
Its arms were tiny (only 3 feet long) but could lift 400 pounds ‚Äî that's like lifting two grown-ups!
T-Rex had the best sense of smell of any dinosaur ‚Äî it could smell prey from miles away!
dinosaurs.sizeComparison: As long as a school bus!

quiz.question: What did T-Rex eat?
quiz.explanation: T-Rex was a fearsome carnivore ‚Äî it ate other dinosaurs!

quiz.question: How big were T-Rex's teeth?
quiz.explanation: T-Rex teeth were as big as bananas ‚Äî some reached 12 inches long!

quiz.question: What does 'Tyrannosaurus Rex' mean?
quiz.explanation: Tyrannosaurus Rex means 'Tyrant Lizard King' ‚Äî a perfect name for this mighty predator!

quiz.question: Where did T-Rex live?
quiz.explanation: T-Rex roamed North America, where we find most of its fossils today!

quiz.question: How fast could T-Rex run?
quiz.explanation: T-Rex could run up to 25 mph ‚Äî faster than most people can sprint!

dinosaurs.diggingClue: You found enormous teeth marks on a bone... what predator could bite this hard?

dinosaurs.name: Triceratops
funFacts: Triceratops had up to 800 teeth! When one wore out, a new one grew in to replace it!
Its giant head shield (called a frill) was as big as a car hood and might have changed colors to show feelings!
Each horn could grow up to 3 feet long ‚Äî perfect for defending against hungry T-Rexes!
Baby Triceratops were born without horns ‚Äî they grew as the dinosaur got older!
Triceratops lived in herds like modern elephants, traveling together to find the best plants to eat!
dinosaurs.sizeComparison: As long as three cars parked end-to-end!

quiz.question: How many horns did Triceratops have?
quiz.explanation: Triceratops means 'Three-Horned Face' ‚Äî it had three awesome horns!

quiz.question: What did Triceratops eat?
quiz.explanation: Triceratops was a plant-eater with hundreds of teeth perfect for chewing tough vegetation!

quiz.question: What is the big shield on Triceratops' head called?
quiz.explanation: The big bony shield is called a frill ‚Äî it protected Triceratops' neck!

quiz.question: How many teeth could Triceratops have?
quiz.explanation: Triceratops could have up to 800 teeth ‚Äî enough to munch tons of plants!

quiz.question: Did Triceratops live alone or in groups?
quiz.explanation: Triceratops lived in herds, traveling together just like elephants do today!

dinosaurs.diggingClue: You discovered a massive three-horned skull with a huge frill... what gentle giant left this behind?

dinosaurs.name: Stegosaurus
funFacts: Stegosaurus had a brain the size of a lime ‚Äî only about as big as a dog's brain!
The plates on its back could grow up to 2 feet tall and might have changed color when it blushed!
Its tail spikes (called a 'thagomizer') were 3 feet long and could swing like a deadly club!
Even though Stegosaurus was huge, it only ate plants and couldn't run very fast ‚Äî just 5 mph!
Scientists once thought Stegosaurus had a second brain in its bottom, but that turned out to be wrong!
dinosaurs.sizeComparison: As tall as a giraffe and as long as a moving truck!

quiz.question: What are the big pointy things on Stegosaurus' back called?
quiz.explanation: Those cool shapes are called plates ‚Äî they ran down Stegosaurus' back in two rows!

quiz.question: What did Stegosaurus eat?
quiz.explanation: Stegosaurus was a gentle plant-eater, munching on low-growing ferns and bushes!

quiz.question: How big was Stegosaurus' brain?
quiz.explanation: Stegosaurus had a tiny brain ‚Äî only about the size of a lime!

quiz.question: What is the weapon on Stegosaurus' tail called?
quiz.explanation: The spiky tail weapon is called a thagomizer ‚Äî perfect for defending against predators!

quiz.question: When did Stegosaurus live?
quiz.explanation: Stegosaurus lived during the Jurassic Period, about 150 million years ago!

dinosaurs.diggingClue: You uncovered huge bony plates and tail spikes... what armored dinosaur had this cool defense?

dinosaurs.name: Velociraptor
funFacts: Real Velociraptors were only about the size of a turkey ‚Äî way smaller than in the movies!
They had feathers! Scientists found fossils with quill knobs, proving they looked more like deadly chickens!
Each foot had a huge 3-inch curved claw that they used to grab and hold prey ‚Äî like a built-in hunting knife!
Velociraptors were super smart for dinosaurs and probably hunted in packs like wolves!
They could run 40 mph ‚Äî that's faster than a galloping horse!
dinosaurs.sizeComparison: About as big as a large turkey or medium dog!

quiz.question: How big was a real Velociraptor?
quiz.explanation: Real Velociraptors were turkey-sized ‚Äî much smaller than in movies!

quiz.question: Did Velociraptors have feathers?
quiz.explanation: Yes! Velociraptors had feathers, making them look like scary chickens!

quiz.question: What special weapon did Velociraptor have on its feet?
quiz.explanation: Each foot had a 3-inch curved claw ‚Äî perfect for catching prey!

quiz.question: How fast could Velociraptor run?
quiz.explanation: Velociraptors could zoom at 40 mph ‚Äî faster than a galloping horse!

quiz.question: Did Velociraptors hunt alone or in groups?
quiz.explanation: Velociraptors were smart hunters that probably worked together in packs!

dinosaurs.diggingClue: You found small fossils with a giant toe claw and signs of feathers... what speedy hunter was this?

dinosaurs.name: Brachiosaurus
funFacts: Brachiosaurus was as tall as a 4-story building ‚Äî it could peek into apartment windows!
Its front legs were longer than its back legs, making it stand like it was going uphill all the time!
One Brachiosaurus weighed as much as 12 elephants ‚Äî that's REALLY heavy!
It had to eat 400 pounds of plants every single day ‚Äî that's like eating 1,600 hamburgers!
Its heart was the size of a washing machine and weighed 400 pounds just to pump blood up that long neck!
dinosaurs.sizeComparison: As tall as a 4-story building and as long as 3 school buses!

quiz.question: What did Brachiosaurus eat?
quiz.explanation: Brachiosaurus ate plants from the tallest trees ‚Äî its long neck was perfect for reaching them!

quiz.question: How tall was Brachiosaurus?
quiz.explanation: Brachiosaurus was as tall as a 4-story building ‚Äî one of the tallest dinosaurs ever!

quiz.question: What was special about Brachiosaurus' legs?
options: The front legs were longer than the back
quiz.explanation: Brachiosaurus' front legs were longer than its back legs ‚Äî very unusual for dinosaurs!

quiz.question: How much did Brachiosaurus eat each day?
quiz.explanation: Brachiosaurus ate about 400 pounds of plants daily to fuel its massive body!

quiz.question: What does 'Brachiosaurus' mean?
quiz.explanation: Brachiosaurus means 'Arm Lizard' because of its long front legs (arms)!

dinosaurs.diggingClue: You unearthed enormous leg bones and super long neck vertebrae... what gentle giant towered above all others?

dinosaurs.name: Pteranodon
funFacts: Pteranodon wasn't actually a dinosaur ‚Äî it was a flying reptile that lived at the same time!
Its wings were HUGE ‚Äî up to 23 feet across, bigger than a small airplane's wings!
It had no teeth! Pteranodon swallowed fish whole, like pelicans do today!
The big crest on its head might have worked like a ship's rudder to help it steer in the air!
Pteranodon was one of the largest animals that ever flew ‚Äî but it only weighed as much as a big turkey!
dinosaurs.sizeComparison: Wingspan wider than a giraffe is tall!

quiz.question: Was Pteranodon a dinosaur?
options: No, it was a flying reptile
quiz.explanation: Pteranodon was a flying reptile, not a dinosaur ‚Äî but it lived during the dinosaur age!

quiz.question: What did Pteranodon eat?
quiz.explanation: Pteranodon ate fish, diving down to catch them from the water!

quiz.question: Did Pteranodon have teeth?
quiz.explanation: Pteranodon had no teeth ‚Äî it swallowed fish whole!

quiz.question: How wide were Pteranodon's wings?
quiz.explanation: Pteranodon's wings stretched up to 23 feet across ‚Äî massive!

quiz.question: What was the crest on Pteranodon's head used for?
quiz.explanation: The head crest probably helped Pteranodon steer while flying, like a rudder!

dinosaurs.diggingClue: You spotted delicate wing bones and a skull with a tall crest... what soared through prehistoric skies?

dinosaurs.name: Parasaurolophus
funFacts: Parasaurolophus had a huge tube-shaped crest on its head that worked like a trumpet ‚Äî it could make loud honking sounds!
The crest was 6 feet long ‚Äî longer than most adult humans are tall!
It could walk on two legs OR four legs, switching depending on whether it was eating or running!
Scientists think the crest sounds helped Parasaurolophus talk to each other across long distances, like dinosaur walkie-talkies!
It had hundreds of tiny teeth perfect for grinding up tough plants ‚Äî like having a built-in food processor!
dinosaurs.sizeComparison: As long as a fire truck!

quiz.question: What was special about Parasaurolophus' head?
options: It had a long tube-shaped crest
quiz.explanation: Parasaurolophus had an amazing long tube-shaped crest that made trumpet-like sounds!

quiz.question: What did Parasaurolophus eat?
quiz.explanation: Parasaurolophus was a plant-eater with hundreds of teeth for grinding vegetation!

quiz.question: How did Parasaurolophus walk?
quiz.explanation: Parasaurolophus could walk on two legs or four ‚Äî it switched depending on what it was doing!

quiz.question: What did Parasaurolophus use its crest for?
quiz.explanation: The crest made loud honking sounds so Parasaurolophus could talk to each other!

quiz.question: How long was Parasaurolophus' crest?
quiz.explanation: The crest was about 6 feet long ‚Äî taller than most adults!

dinosaurs.diggingClue: You uncovered a bizarre tube-shaped skull crest... what musical dinosaur used this to communicate?
